titleproper.value: Guide to the Mulvey Family Papers <num>AIA.043</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-06-10T16:56:03</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize folder in a shared box, and 1 rolled banner

abstract.value: This collection consists mainly of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's trip to Ireland in 1963, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland. Elizabeth Mulvey was a teacher and later public school principal in the Bronx. Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Mulvey Family Papers; AIA 043; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
An additional accession was donated by Kathleen Mulvey in 2018.  The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.098.
Kathleen Mulvey was the first woman president of the Irish Institute and an active member of the County Carlow Society.

This collection consists of materials collected by Kathleen Mulvey documenting her family history. The collection includes family correspondence, panoramas of Irish American social organization functions, and a scrapbook from Elizabeth Mulvey's first trip to Europe in the late 1920s, which included visits to Ireland, Italy, France, and Switzerland.  The collection also contains a banner celebrating John F. Kennedy's visit to Ireland in 1963.

subject.value: Irish Americans -- New York (State) -- New York.
Irish Americans -- New York (State) -- New York -- Social life and customs.
